main event: A sighting of an unidentified object was reported over Richmond, Virginia, on February 16, 1965, with an observation duration of 45 minutes.
interesting points: The object was first spotted at approximately 35,000 feet altitude and was described as circular, measuring 40-50 feet in diameter., It had a bright silver color that changed to dull red and blue during the sighting., The object hovered for a short period and then took off at very high speed towards the easterly direction., The sighting was observed visually and reported by both civilian and military sources., A prior report indicated a possible balloon launch from Ray Experiment leading to speculation about the object's identity.
